meanings.definition: An inhabitant or resident of a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The friendly denizen of the forest greeted us warmly.
meanings.sent2: The denizen of the city knew all the best places to eat.
meanings.sent3: The denizen of the zoo had a great sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: The denizen of the library, the bookworm, devoured novels like candy.
meanings.sent5: The denizen of the beach, a seagull, soared gracefully in the sky.

meanings.definition: A person, plant, or animal that is native to a particular area.
meanings.sent1: The colorful denizen of the rainforest was a rare bird species.
meanings.sent2: The denizen of the desert, the cactus, thrived in the arid climate.
meanings.sent3: The denizen of the garden, a squirrel, loved to play hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The denizen of the ocean, a dolphin, danced elegantly in the waves.
meanings.sent5: The denizen of the mountain, a bear, roamed freely in its natural habitat.

meanings.definition: To make a resident or inhabitant of a place.
meanings.sent1: The family decided to denizen the abandoned house and make it their home.
meanings.sent2: The king wanted to denizen the foreign prince in his kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The magician used his wand to denizen the puppet with life.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush strokes seemed to denizen the canvas with movement.
meanings.sent5: The gardener's care and attention helped denizen the garden with colorful flowers.
